meanings.definition: A person who wastes time or engages in trivial activities.
meanings.sent1: The piddlers in the park spent hours watching ants crawl.
meanings.sent2: She dismissed him as just another piddler with no ambition.
meanings.sent3: The piddlers at the office always find ways to avoid work.
meanings.sent4: His friends called him the king of piddlers for his love of idle chatter.
meanings.sent5: Beware of becoming a piddler, for time is precious and should not be wasted.

meanings.definition: A small amount or insignificant quantity.
meanings.sent1: He only had a piddlers amount of coins in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a piddlers pinch of salt to the soup.
meanings.sent3: She found a piddlers number of shells on the beach.
meanings.sent4: The piddlers of rain did little to quench the dry soil.
meanings.sent5: The thief only managed to steal a piddlers sum before being caught.

meanings.definition: To waste time or engage in trivial activities.
meanings.sent1: Stop piddling around and finish your homework.
meanings.sent2: She piddled away the afternoon browsing social media.
meanings.sent3: The cat piddled with a ball of yarn, amusing itself for hours.
meanings.sent4: He piddled his chances of success by procrastinating.
meanings.sent5: Don't piddle your life away on meaningless pursuits; focus on what truly matters.
